cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 130 miles south of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving northward, then forecast to turn northeast and parallel the southeast U.S. coastline toward the Carolinas and Mid-Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just along the South Carolina coast (around Charleston area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch north of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to Savannah River GA (well north of PortMiami)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning Flagler/Volusia County line FL northward; Hurricane Warning from north of Savannah River to NC/VA border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: southeast U.S. coast from northeast Florida through the Carolinas and Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts had affected South Florida earlier but are now subsiding; only breezy conditions expected going forward.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge inundation expected for Miami as surge threat is confined to northeast Florida northward.
weather_observation.rainfall: Only scattered showers; heavy rainfall core remains well north of Miami.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Hazardous surf and rip currents will linger along South Florida beaches for another 24â€“36 h.
